page.title: 07INDUSTRY TEXTILES CARPETS
page.content: {AIREDALE CARPETS In the same building as Edmondson Brothers,which used to be one big weaving mill,is a larger works where carpets are made.Mrs Carradice has worked there for ten years and the works employ 100 people,some of them teenagers.There are 50 different carpet names.The wool for the carpets comes in big sacks from Huddersfield,and the carpets are 80 per cent wool and 20 per cent nylon, a man made fibre.The carpets are woven on big looms in a noisy room and are checked for any mistakes before being sold. If there are any big faults these are"mended" in the factory. Some of the smaller carpets are exported to America.The firm has a retail shop called Royd Mill where people can buy carpets and rugs.
